case_name: Veerpal Singh v. Deputy Registrar, Cooperative Societies

facts.text: Writ Petition No. 298 of 1971 was filed under Article 32 of the Constitution of India for the enforcement of fundamental rights.

anchor.surface_text: Writ Petition No. 298 of 1971. Petition under Article 32 of the Constitution of India for the enforcement of fundamental rights

facts.text: Civil Appeal No. 593 of 1972 was filed by special leave from the judgment and order dated November 24, 1971 of the High Court of Allahabad in W.P. No. 6667/71.

anchor.surface_text: and Civil Appeal No. 593 of 1972. Appeal by a special leave from the judgment and order dated November 24, 1971 of the High Court of Allahabad in W.P. No. 6667/71.

facts.text: The High Court of Allahabad passed judgment and order dated November 24, 1971 in W.P. No. 6667/71.

anchor.surface_text: Appeal by a special leave from the judgment and order dated November 24, 1971 of the High Court of Allahabad in W.P. No. 6667/71. K. Sen, A. P. Singh Chauhan, V. C. Prashar and Dharmpal Singh Chauhan, for the petitioner and appellant.

facts.text: The Allahabad High Court dismissed in limine the petition under Article 226 on 29 November, 1971.

anchor.surface_text: The appeal is from the order dated 29 November, 1971 of the Allahabad High Court dismissing in limine the petition under Article 226 of the Constitution. In that petition the appellant Yograj Singh and others challenged the aforesaid order dated 14 July, 1971 suspending the President and the companymittee of management of Jahangirabad Cooperative Marketing Society.

facts.text: Veerpal Singh was the President of the Jahangirabad Cooperative Marketing Society Ltd., Jahangirabad.

anchor.surface_text: The petitioner Veerpal Singh was the President of the Jahangirabad Cooperative Marketing Society. By that order the Deputy Registrar, Cooperative Societies suspended the President and the companymittee of management of Jahangirabad Cooperative Marketing Society Ltd., Jahangirabad.

facts.text: Deputy Registrar, Cooperative Societies, Meerut passed order dated 14 July, 1971 suspending the President and the committee of management of Jahangirabad Cooperative Marketing Society.

anchor.surface_text: The petitioner in this writ petition impeaches the order dated 14 July, 1971 passed by the Deputy Registrar, Cooperative Societies, Meerut, By that order the Deputy Registrar, Cooperative Societies suspended the President and the companymittee of management of Jahangirabad Cooperative Marketing Society Ltd., Jahangirabad.

facts.text: Deputy Registrar appointed Ghanshyam Murari Sharma, Additional District Cooperative Officer, Bulandshahr as Administrator to carry on the functions of the society.

anchor.surface_text: By that order the Deputy Registrar further appointed Ghanshyam Murari Sharma, Additional District Cooperative Officer, Bulandshahr as Administrator to carry on the functions of the society.

facts.text: Appellant Yograj Singh and others challenged the order dated 14 July, 1971 in petition under Article 226 before Allahabad High Court.

anchor.surface_text: In that petition the appellant Yograj Singh and others challenged the aforesaid order dated 14 July, 1971 suspending the President and the companymittee of management of Jahangirabad Cooperative Marketing Society.

facts.text: Petitioner contended that the order of suspension is void because made mala fide and for collateral purpose of withdrawing the petitioner from the committee.

anchor.surface_text: Counsel on behalf of the petitioner raised three companytentions for impeaching the order of suspension. First, it was said that the order of suspension is void because it is made mala fide and exercised for the companylateral purpose of withdrawing the petitioner from the companymittee of management to which he, was elected and in which he companytinued his office.

facts.text: Petitioner contended that no supersession proceedings as contemplated in section 35 of the Act were initiated, no opportunity given to Society, no opinion of general body obtained.

anchor.surface_text: Secondly, it was said that the order of suspension is bad because there were numbersupersession proceedings as companytemplated in section 35 of the Act. The Registrar did number give an opportunity to the Society and did number hear the Society. The Registrar did number obtain the opinion of the general body of the society as to the suspension of the companymittee.

facts.text: There was an inspection of the Jahangirabad Cooperative Marketing Society in April 1969.

anchor.surface_text: In the month of April 1969 there was an inspection of the Jahangirabad Cooperative Marketing Society  hereinafter referred to as the Society .

facts.text: Petitioner was re-elected as a Director of the management of the society in October 1969.

anchor.surface_text: In the month of October, 1969 the petitioner was reelected as a Director of the management of the society.

facts.text: In October 1969, petitioner was appointed as a delegate by the committee of management of the Society to the Provincial Cooperative Federation.

anchor.surface_text: Again, in the month of October, 1969 the petitioner was appointed as a delegate by the companymittee of management of the Society to the Provincial Cooperative Federation.

facts.text: General body of the Provincial Cooperative Federation elected the petitioner to the committee of management of the Federation.

anchor.surface_text: Subsequently, the general body of the Provincial Cooperative Federation elected the petitioner to the companymittee of management of the Federation.

facts.text: Petitioner was elected Chairman of the Provincial Cooperative Federation in April 1970.

anchor.surface_text: In the month of April 1970, the petitioner was also elected Chairman of the Provincial Cooperative Federation.

facts.text: In September 1979, Uttar Pradesh Government nominated 10 members and a Chairman of the Federation at instance of Deputy Registrar and Shri Yadav, omitting the petitioner.

anchor.surface_text: In the month of September 1979 at the instance and under the direction of the Deputy Registrar who had been a former Secretary of the Federation and of Shri Yadav the then Minister of Cooperative Society, the Uttar Pradesh Government numberinated 10. members and a Chairman of the Federation. The petitioner who was the then Chairman, was however omitted from the list of the U.P. Government.

facts.text: In December 1970, new Ministry of U.P. Government revoked the previous order of September 1970.

anchor.surface_text: In the month of December, 1970 the new Ministry of the U.P. Government revoked the previous order of Government made in the month of September, 1970.

facts.text: In June 1971, new Ministry nominated 10 members in committee of management of Federation under section 34(1) and appointed Additional Registrar as President.

anchor.surface_text: In the month of June, 1971 there was again a new Ministry in which Shri Yadav again became the Minister of Cooperative Society. The Government then numberinated 10 members in the companymittee of management of the Federation under section 34 1  of the Act and appointed the Additional Registrar of Cooperative Society as the President.

facts.text: In June 1971, a lot was drawn and petitioner survived his office in the Provincial Cooperative Federation.

anchor.surface_text: In the month of June, 1971 a lot was drawn to find out which of the Directors of the Provincial Cooperative Federation were to, vacate the office in order to make room for the numberinees of the Government. The petitioner survived his office in the lot.

facts.text: Petitioner made application for amendment alleging conspiracy by Shri Yadav and Tyagi to suspend committee of Federation and that withdrawal of delegation was antedated.

anchor.surface_text: The petitioner made an application for amendment of the petition. In that application for amendment, allegations were made, that Shri Yadav and Tyagi both companytrived to suspend the companymittee of management of the Federation. It was also alleged that the withdrawal of the delegation of the petitioner to the Provincial Cooperative Federation was ante dated.

facts.text: Letter dated 15 July 1971 sent by administrator withdrawing delegation of petitioner to U.P. Provincial Cooperative Federation.

anchor.surface_text: The order of withdrawal was dated 15 July,, 1971. The letter dated 15 July, 1971 is said to have been sent by the administrator of the Society withdrawing the delegation of the petitioner to the U.P. Provincial Cooperative, Federation.

facts.text: Petitioner denies that the letter dated 15 July 1971 withdrawing delegation was sent.

anchor.surface_text: The Petitioner denies that alleged fact.

facts.text: Court did not allow amendment of the petition because no facts alleged to raise plea of malafide.

anchor.surface_text: In view of the fact that the petitioner did number allege facts toe raise any plea of malafide acts on the part of the respondents this. Court did number allow any amendment of the petition.

facts.text: No supersession proceedings under section 35(1) of the Act had commenced before the suspension order.

anchor.surface_text: The proceedings for supersession of the companymittee of management have number companymenced. The proceedings can companymence only when the necessary step to companymence it is taken.

facts.text: Power to suspend committee under section 35(2) is exercisable only during period of supersession proceedings.

anchor.surface_text: The power of suspension of the companymittee of management is, to be found in section 35 2  of the Act. ... The power to suspend the companymittee of management during the period of proceedings is exercisable when proceedings for supersession have companymenced.

facts.text: Appointment of administrator under section 35(2) requires supersession proceedings to have commenced.

anchor.surface_text: An appointment of administrator during the interim period is therefore number ruled out of the provisions of section 35 2  of the Act, but the prerequisite companydition to the appointment of the interim administrator has number been fulfilled in the present case, because numberproceedings for the supersession of the companymittee of management of the society have companymenced.

facts.text: Administrator appointed by Deputy Registrar withdrew delegation of Veerpal Singh to Uttar Pradesh Provincial Cooperative Federation.

anchor.surface_text: The administrator appointed by the Registrar withdrew the delegation of the petitioner appellant Veerpal Singh to the Uttar Pradesh Provincial Cooperative Federation.

facts.text: Court set aside and quashed the order dated 14 July, 1971.

anchor.surface_text: For these reasons, the order dated 14 July, 1971 is set aside and quashed. The petition succeeds. The appeal is also allowed.

facts.text: Appointment of administrator was bad because no supersession proceedings commenced.

anchor.surface_text: The Registrar companyld number appoint an administrator. The reasons are these. The proceedings for supersession of the companymittee of management have number companymenced.

facts.text: Withdrawal of delegation by administrator was bad due to invalid appointment of administrator.

anchor.surface_text: Under Rule 86 of the Uttar Pradesh Cooperative Societies Rules 1968 a person who is a delegate of a companyperative society shall cease to be such delegate if he is withdrawn by the companymittee, administrator or administrators appointed by the Registrar under section 35 of the Act. In the present case the appointment of the administrator is bad as indicated earlier. The act of the Registrar in withdrawing the dele- gation of Veerpal Singh is also bad because of his infirmity to act is an administrator.

arguments.claim: Suspension under section 35(2) exercisable only when proceedings for supersession under section 35(1) have commenced

arguments.claim: Interim suspension and administrator appointment under s.35(2) requires opinion that necessary in interest of society during proceedings

anchor.surface_text: The interim suspension of the committee of management under section 35(2) of the Act is when in the opinion of the Registrar the suspension of the committee of management during the period of proceedings is necessary in the interest of the society.

holdings.text: Administrator could not withdraw delegation under Rule 86 as appointment invalid

anchor.surface_text: Under Rule 86 of the Uttar Pradesh Cooperative Societies Rules 1968 a person who is a delegate of a companyperative society shall cease to be such delegate if he is withdrawn by the companymittee, administrator or administrators appointed by the Registrar under section 35 of the Act. In the present case the appointment of the administrator is bad as indicated earlier. The act of the Registrar in withdrawing the dele- gation of Veerpal Singh is also bad because of his infirmity to act is an administrator.

holdings.reasoning_summary: Withdrawal power under Rule 86 depends on valid appointment under section 35

anchor.surface_text: Under Rule 86 of the Uttar Pradesh Cooperative Societies Rules 1968 a person who is a delegate of a companyperative society shall cease to be such delegate if he is withdrawn by the companymittee, administrator or administrators appointed by the Registrar under section 35 of the Act. In the present case the appointment of the administrator is bad as indicated earlier. The act of the Registrar in withdrawing the dele- gation of Veerpal Singh is also bad because of his infirmity to act is an administrator.
For these reasons, the order dated 14 July, 1971 is set aside and quashed. The petition succeeds. The appeal is also allowed.
